constant.description: (test) checks if a variable has the exact same value as a constant. You can use either global constants or class constants

defined.description: (test) checks if a variable is defined in the current context. This is very useful if you use the strict_variables option

divisible.description: (test) checks if a variable is divisible by a number

empty.description: (test) checks if a variable is null, false, an empty array, or the empty string

even.description: (test) checks if the given number is even

iterable.description: (test) checks if a variable is an array or a traversable object

null.description: (test) checks if the variable is null

same as.description: (test) checks if a variable is the same as another variable. This is the equivalent to === in PHP
